trans-unit.source: Custom-provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Custom-provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to custom-provision clusters for Azure HDInsight by using the Azure Preview Portal, Azure PowerShell, a command line, or a .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to custom-provision clusters for Azure HDInsight by using the Azure Preview Portal, Azure PowerShell, a command line, or a .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to plan for provision HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to plan for provision HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: Basic configuration options
trans-unit.target: Basic configuration options

trans-unit.source: Cluster name
trans-unit.target: Cluster name

trans-unit.source: Cluster name is used to identify a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Cluster name is used to identify a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Cluster name must follow the following guidelines:
trans-unit.target: Cluster name must follow the following guidelines:

trans-unit.source: The field must be a string that contains between 3 and 63 characters
trans-unit.target: The field must be a string that contains between 3 and 63 characters

trans-unit.source: The field can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.
trans-unit.target: The field can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.

trans-unit.source: Subscription name
trans-unit.target: Subscription name

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster is tied to one Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster is tied to one Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Resource group name
trans-unit.target: Resource group name

trans-unit.source: Applications are typically made up of many components, for example a web app, database, database server, storage, and 3rd party services.
trans-unit.target: Applications are typically made up of many components, for example a web app, database, database server, storage, and 3rd party services.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group, referred to as an Azure Resource Group.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group, referred to as an Azure Resource Group.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy, update, monitor or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy, update, monitor or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.

trans-unit.source: You use a template for deployment and that template can work for different environments such as testing, staging and production.
trans-unit.target: You use a template for deployment and that template can work for different environments such as testing, staging and production.

trans-unit.source: You can clarify billing for your organization by viewing the rolled-up costs for the entire group.
trans-unit.target: You can clarify billing for your organization by viewing the rolled-up costs for the entire group.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: Operating system
trans-unit.target: Operating system

trans-unit.source: You can provision HDInsight clusters on one of the following two operating systems:
trans-unit.target: You can provision HDInsight clusters on one of the following two operating systems:

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight on Windows (Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter)**:
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight on Windows (Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter)**:

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight on Linux (Ubuntu 12.04 LTS for Linux) (Preview)**: HDInsight provides the option of configuring Linux clusters on Azure.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight on Linux (Ubuntu 12.04 LTS for Linux) (Preview)**: HDInsight provides the option of configuring Linux clusters on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Configure a Linux cluster if you are familiar with Linux or Unix, migrating from an existing Linux-based Hadoop solution, or want easy integration with Hadoop ecosystem components built for Linux.
trans-unit.target: Configure a Linux cluster if you are familiar with Linux or Unix, migrating from an existing Linux-based Hadoop solution, or want easy integration with Hadoop ecosystem components built for Linux.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started with Hadoop on Linux in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started with Hadoop on Linux in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: HDInsight version
trans-unit.target: HDInsight version

trans-unit.source: It is used to determine the version of HDInsight to use for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: It is used to determine the version of HDInsight to use for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Hadoop cluster versions and components in HDInsight](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=320896&clcid=0x409)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Hadoop cluster versions and components in HDInsight](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=320896&clcid=0x409)

trans-unit.source: **Cluster type** and **cluster size (a.k.a. data nodes)**
trans-unit.target: **Cluster type** and **cluster size (a.k.a. data nodes)**

trans-unit.source: HDInsight allows customers to deploy a variety of cluster types, for different data analytics workloads.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight allows customers to deploy a variety of cluster types, for different data analytics workloads.

trans-unit.source: Cluster types offered today are:
trans-unit.target: Cluster types offered today are:

trans-unit.source: Hadoop clusters: for query and analysis workloads
trans-unit.target: Hadoop clusters: for query and analysis workloads

trans-unit.source: HBase clusters: for NoSQL workloads
trans-unit.target: HBase clusters: for NoSQL workloads

trans-unit.source: Storm clusters: for real time event processing workloads
trans-unit.target: Storm clusters: for real time event processing workloads

trans-unit.source: Spark clusters (preview): for in-memory processing, interactive queries, stream, and machines learning workloads.
trans-unit.target: Spark clusters (preview): for in-memory processing, interactive queries, stream, and machines learning workloads.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] *Azure HDInsight cluster* is also called *Hadoop clusters in HDInsight*, or *HDInsight cluster*.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] *Azure HDInsight cluster* is also called *Hadoop clusters in HDInsight*, or *HDInsight cluster*.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, it is used interchangeably with *Hadoop cluster*.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, it is used interchangeably with *Hadoop cluster*.

trans-unit.source: They all refer to the Hadoop clusters hosted in the Microsoft Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: They all refer to the Hadoop clusters hosted in the Microsoft Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: Within a given cluster type, there are different roles for the various nodes, which allow a customer to size those nodes in a given role appropriate to the details of their workload.
trans-unit.target: Within a given cluster type, there are different roles for the various nodes, which allow a customer to size those nodes in a given role appropriate to the details of their workload.

trans-unit.source: For example, a Hadoop cluster can have its worker nodes provisioned with a large amount of memory if the type of analytics being performed are memory intensive.
trans-unit.target: For example, a Hadoop cluster can have its worker nodes provisioned with a large amount of memory if the type of analytics being performed are memory intensive.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles

trans-unit.source: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight are deployed with two roles:
trans-unit.target: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight are deployed with two roles:

trans-unit.source: Head node (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head node (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Data node (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Data node (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles

trans-unit.source: HBase clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:
trans-unit.target: HBase clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:

trans-unit.source: Head servers (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head servers (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Region servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Region servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles

trans-unit.source: Storm clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:
trans-unit.target: Storm clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:

trans-unit.source: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Region/virtual network (a.k.a.
trans-unit.target: Region/virtual network (a.k.a.

trans-unit.source: location)
trans-unit.target: location)

trans-unit.source: Azure regions
trans-unit.target: Azure regions

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported regions, click the **Region** drop-down list on [HDInsight pricing](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=282635&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported regions, click the **Region** drop-down list on [HDInsight pricing](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=282635&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: Node size
trans-unit.target: Node size

trans-unit.source: hdinsight vm node sizes
trans-unit.target: hdinsight vm node sizes

trans-unit.source: Select the VM size for the nodes.
trans-unit.target: Select the VM size for the nodes.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Sizes for Cloud Services](cloud-services-sizes-specs.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Sizes for Cloud Services](cloud-services-sizes-specs.md)

trans-unit.source: Based on the choice of VMs, your cost might vary.
trans-unit.target: Based on the choice of VMs, your cost might vary.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses all standard-tier VMs for cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses all standard-tier VMs for cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: For information on how VM sizes affect your prices, see HDInsight Pricing.
trans-unit.target: For information on how VM sizes affect your prices, see HDInsight Pricing.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight users
trans-unit.target: HDInsight users

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight clusters allow you to configure two user accounts during provisioning:
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight clusters allow you to configure two user accounts during provisioning:

trans-unit.source: HTTP user.
trans-unit.target: HTTP user.

trans-unit.source: The default user name is admin using the basic configuration on the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: The default user name is admin using the basic configuration on the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: RDP user (Windows clusters): It is used to connect to the cluster using RDP.
trans-unit.target: RDP user (Windows clusters): It is used to connect to the cluster using RDP.

trans-unit.source: When you create the account, you must set an expiration date that is within 90 days from today.
trans-unit.target: When you create the account, you must set an expiration date that is within 90 days from today.

trans-unit.source: SSH User (Linux clusters): Is used to connect to the cluster using SSH.
trans-unit.target: SSH User (Linux clusters): Is used to connect to the cluster using SSH.

trans-unit.source: You can create additional SSH user accounts after the cluster is created by following the steps in [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).
trans-unit.target: You can create additional SSH user accounts after the cluster is created by following the steps in [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure storage account
trans-unit.target: Azure storage account

trans-unit.source: The original HDFS uses of many local disks on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The original HDFS uses of many local disks on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage instead for data storage.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage instead for data storage.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob storage is a robust, general-purpose storage solution that integrates seamlessly with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob storage is a robust, general-purpose storage solution that integrates seamlessly with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Through a Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) interface, the full set of components in HDInsight can operate directly on structured or unstructured data in Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Through a Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) interface, the full set of components in HDInsight can operate directly on structured or unstructured data in Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Storing data in Blob storage enables you to safely delete the HDInsight clusters that are used for computation without losing user data.
trans-unit.target: Storing data in Blob storage enables you to safely delete the HDInsight clusters that are used for computation without losing user data.

trans-unit.source: During configuration, you must specify an Azure storage account and an Azure Blob storage container on the Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: During configuration, you must specify an Azure storage account and an Azure Blob storage container on the Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Some provision process requires the Azure storage account and the Blob storage container created beforehand.
trans-unit.target: Some provision process requires the Azure storage account and the Blob storage container created beforehand.

trans-unit.source: The Blob storage container is used as the default storage location by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Blob storage container is used as the default storage location by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can specify additional Azure Storage accounts (linked storage) that will be accessible by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can specify additional Azure Storage accounts (linked storage) that will be accessible by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the cluster can also access any Blob containers that are configured with full public read access or pulic read access for blobs only.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the cluster can also access any Blob containers that are configured with full public read access or pulic read access for blobs only.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the restrict access, see [Manage Access to Azure Storage Resources](storage-manage-access-to-resources.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the restrict access, see [Manage Access to Azure Storage Resources](storage-manage-access-to-resources.md).

trans-unit.source: HDInsight storage
trans-unit.target: HDInsight storage

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] A Blob storage container provides a grouping of a set of blobs as shown in the image:
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] A Blob storage container provides a grouping of a set of blobs as shown in the image:

trans-unit.source: Azure blob storage
trans-unit.target: Azure blob storage

trans-unit.source: Hive/Oozie metastore
trans-unit.target: Hive/Oozie metastore

trans-unit.source: The metastore contains Hive and Oozie metadata, such as Hive tables, partitions, schemas, and columns.
trans-unit.target: The metastore contains Hive and Oozie metadata, such as Hive tables, partitions, schemas, and columns.

trans-unit.source: Using the metastore helps you to retain your Hive and Oozie metadata, so that you don't need to re-create Hive tables or Oozie jobs when you provision a new cluster.
trans-unit.target: Using the metastore helps you to retain your Hive and Oozie metadata, so that you don't need to re-create Hive tables or Oozie jobs when you provision a new cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, Hive uses an embedded Azure SQL database to store this information.
trans-unit.target: By default, Hive uses an embedded Azure SQL database to store this information.

trans-unit.source: The embedded database can't preserve the metadata when the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: The embedded database can't preserve the metadata when the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For example, you have a cluster provisioned with a Hive metastore.
trans-unit.target: For example, you have a cluster provisioned with a Hive metastore.

trans-unit.source: You created some Hive tables.
trans-unit.target: You created some Hive tables.

trans-unit.source: After you delete the cluster, and recreat the cluster using the same Hive metastore, you will be able to see the Hive tables you created in the original cluster.
trans-unit.target: After you delete the cluster, and recreat the cluster using the same Hive metastore, you will be able to see the Hive tables you created in the original cluster.

trans-unit.source: Advanced configuration options
trans-unit.target: Advanced configuration options

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This section currently only apply to Windows base HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This section currently only apply to Windows base HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Customize clusters using HDInsight cluster customization
trans-unit.target: Customize clusters using HDInsight cluster customization

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, you want to configure the configuration files.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, you want to configure the configuration files.

trans-unit.source: Here are some of them.
trans-unit.target: Here are some of them.

trans-unit.source: core-site.xml
trans-unit.target: core-site.xml

trans-unit.source: hdfs-site.xml
trans-unit.target: hdfs-site.xml

trans-unit.source: mapred-site.xml
trans-unit.target: mapred-site.xml

trans-unit.source: yarn-site.xml
trans-unit.target: yarn-site.xml

trans-unit.source: hive-site.xml
trans-unit.target: hive-site.xml

trans-unit.source: oozie-site.xml
trans-unit.target: oozie-site.xml

trans-unit.source: The clusters can't retain the changes due to re-image.
trans-unit.target: The clusters can't retain the changes due to re-image.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Role Instance Restarts Due to OS Upgrades](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kwill/archive/2012/09/19/role-instance-restarts-due-to-os-upgrades.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Role Instance Restarts Due to OS Upgrades](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kwill/archive/2012/09/19/role-instance-restarts-due-to-os-upgrades.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To keep the changes through the clusters' lifetime, you can use HDInsight cluster customization during the provision process.
trans-unit.target: To keep the changes through the clusters' lifetime, you can use HDInsight cluster customization during the provision process.

trans-unit.source: The following is an Azure PowerShell script example of customizing a Hive configuration:
trans-unit.target: The following is an Azure PowerShell script example of customizing a Hive configuration:

trans-unit.source: Some more samples on customizing other configuration files:
trans-unit.target: Some more samples on customizing other configuration files:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Azim Uddin's blog titled [Customizing HDInsight Cluster provisioning](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/bigdatasupport/archive/2014/04/15/customizing-hdinsight-cluster-provisioning-via-powershell-and-net-sdk.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Azim Uddin's blog titled [Customizing HDInsight Cluster provisioning](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/bigdatasupport/archive/2014/04/15/customizing-hdinsight-cluster-provisioning-via-powershell-and-net-sdk.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Customize clusters using Script action
trans-unit.target: Customize clusters using Script action

trans-unit.source: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during provisioning.
trans-unit.target: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Such scripts are invoked via **Script Action**, which is a configuration option that can be used from the preview portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Such scripts are invoked via **Script Action**, which is a configuration option that can be used from the preview portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).

trans-unit.source: Use Azure virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Use Azure virtual networks

trans-unit.source: [Azure Virtual Network](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Virtual Network](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A virtual network allows you to:
trans-unit.target: A virtual network allows you to:

trans-unit.source: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).
trans-unit.target: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).

trans-unit.source: diagram of cloud-only configuration
trans-unit.target: diagram of cloud-only configuration

trans-unit.source: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).
trans-unit.target: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).

trans-unit.source: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.
trans-unit.target: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.

trans-unit.source: diagram of site-to-site configuration
trans-unit.target: diagram of site-to-site configuration

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.

trans-unit.source: diagram of point-to-site configuration
trans-unit.target: diagram of point-to-site configuration

trans-unit.source: For more information on Virtual Network features, benefits, and capabilities, see the [Azure Virtual Network overview](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on Virtual Network features, benefits, and capabilities, see the [Azure Virtual Network overview](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You must create the Azure virtual network before provisioning an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You must create the Azure virtual network before provisioning an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Provision a Hadoop cluster into a virtual network](hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet.md#provision-an-hbase-cluster-into-a-virtual-network).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Provision a Hadoop cluster into a virtual network](hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet.md#provision-an-hbase-cluster-into-a-virtual-network).

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight only supports location-based Virtual Networks, and does not currently work with Affinity Group-based Virtual Networks.
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight only supports location-based Virtual Networks, and does not currently work with Affinity Group-based Virtual Networks.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure PowerShell cmdlet Get-AzureVNetConfig to check whether an existing Azure virtual network is location-based.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure PowerShell cmdlet Get-AzureVNetConfig to check whether an existing Azure virtual network is location-based.

trans-unit.source: If your virtual network is not location-based, you have the following options:
trans-unit.target: If your virtual network is not location-based, you have the following options:

trans-unit.source: Export the existing Virtual Network configuration and then create a new Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Export the existing Virtual Network configuration and then create a new Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: All new Virtual Networks are location based by default.
trans-unit.target: All new Virtual Networks are location based by default.

trans-unit.source: Migrate to a location-based Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Migrate to a location-based Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: See [Migrate existing services to regional scope](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/11/26/migrating-existing-services-to-regional-scope/).
trans-unit.target: See [Migrate existing services to regional scope](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/11/26/migrating-existing-services-to-regional-scope/).

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended to designate a single subnet for one cluster.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended to designate a single subnet for one cluster.

trans-unit.source: Provision using the preview portal
trans-unit.target: Provision using the preview portal

trans-unit.source: You can refer to the [basic configuration options], and the [advanced configuration options] for the explanations of the fields.
trans-unit.target: You can refer to the [basic configuration options], and the [advanced configuration options] for the explanations of the fields.

trans-unit.source: To create an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: To create an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure preview portal][azure-preview-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure preview portal][azure-preview-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **NEW**, Click **Data Analytics**, and then click **HDInsight**.
trans-unit.target: Click **NEW**, Click **Data Analytics**, and then click **HDInsight**.

trans-unit.source: Creating a new cluster in the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Creating a new cluster in the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: **Cluster Name**: Enter a name for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster Name**: Enter a name for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear beside the cluster name if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear beside the cluster name if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster Type**: Select **Hadoop**.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster Type**: Select **Hadoop**.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster Operating System**: Select **Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter**.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster Operating System**: Select **Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter**.

trans-unit.source: **Subscription**: Select the Azure subscription that will be used for provision this cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Subscription**: Select the Azure subscription that will be used for provision this cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Resource Group**: Select an existing or create a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: **Resource Group**: Select an existing or create a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.
trans-unit.target: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.

trans-unit.source: **Credentials**: Configure the username and the password for the Hadoop user (HTTP user).
trans-unit.target: **Credentials**: Configure the username and the password for the Hadoop user (HTTP user).

trans-unit.source: If you enable remote desktop for the cluster, you will need to configure the remote desktop user username and password, and an account expiration date.
trans-unit.target: If you enable remote desktop for the cluster, you will need to configure the remote desktop user username and password, and an account expiration date.

trans-unit.source: Click **Select** at the bottom to save the changes.
trans-unit.target: Click **Select** at the bottom to save the changes.

trans-unit.source: Provide cluster credentials
trans-unit.target: Provide cluster credentials

trans-unit.source: **Data Source**: Create a new or select an existing Azure Storage account to be used as the default file system for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Data Source**: Create a new or select an existing Azure Storage account to be used as the default file system for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Data source blade
trans-unit.target: Data source blade

trans-unit.source: **Selection Method**: Set this to **From all subscriptions** to enable browsing of storage accounts from all your subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: **Selection Method**: Set this to **From all subscriptions** to enable browsing of storage accounts from all your subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Set this to **Access Key** if you want to enter the **Storage Name** and **Access Key** of an existing storage account.
trans-unit.target: Set this to **Access Key** if you want to enter the **Storage Name** and **Access Key** of an existing storage account.

trans-unit.source: **Select storage account / Create New**: Click **Select storage account** to browse and select an existing storage account you want to associate with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Select storage account / Create New**: Click **Select storage account** to browse and select an existing storage account you want to associate with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Or, click **Create New** to create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Or, click **Create New** to create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: **Choose Default Container**: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Choose Default Container**: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.
trans-unit.target: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Location**: The geographic region that the storage account is in, or will be created in.
trans-unit.target: **Location**: The geographic region that the storage account is in, or will be created in.

trans-unit.source: This location will determine the cluster location.
trans-unit.target: This location will determine the cluster location.

trans-unit.source: The cluster and its default storage account must co-locate in the same Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: The cluster and its default storage account must co-locate in the same Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: **Node Pricing Tiers**: Set the number of worker nodes that you need for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Node Pricing Tiers**: Set the number of worker nodes that you need for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown within the blade.
trans-unit.target: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown within the blade.

trans-unit.source: Node pricing tiers blade
trans-unit.target: Node pricing tiers blade

trans-unit.source: **Optional Configuration** to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a **Virtual Network**, setting up an **External Metastore** to hold data for Hive and Oozie, use Script Actions to customize a cluster to install custom components, or use additional storage accounts with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Optional Configuration** to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a **Virtual Network**, setting up an **External Metastore** to hold data for Hive and Oozie, use Script Actions to customize a cluster to install custom components, or use additional storage accounts with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight Version**: Select the version you want to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight Version**: Select the version you want to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [HDInsight cluster versions](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [HDInsight cluster versions](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).

trans-unit.source: **Virtual Network**: Select an Azure virtual network and the subnet if you want to place the cluster into a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: **Virtual Network**: Select an Azure virtual network and the subnet if you want to place the cluster into a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Virtual network blade
trans-unit.target: Virtual network blade

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Windows based HDInsight cluster can only be placed into a classical virtual network.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Windows based HDInsight cluster can only be placed into a classical virtual network.

trans-unit.source: **External Metastores**: Specify an Azure SQL database to store Hive and Oozie metadata associated with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **External Metastores**: Specify an Azure SQL database to store Hive and Oozie metadata associated with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Custom metastores blade
trans-unit.target: Custom metastores blade

trans-unit.source: For **Use an existing SQL DB for Hive** metadata, click **Yes**, select a SQL database, and then provide the username/password for the database.
trans-unit.target: For **Use an existing SQL DB for Hive** metadata, click **Yes**, select a SQL database, and then provide the username/password for the database.

trans-unit.source: Repeat these steps if you want to **Use an existing SQL DB for Oozie metadata**.
trans-unit.target: Repeat these steps if you want to **Use an existing SQL DB for Oozie metadata**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Select** till you are back on the **Optional Configuration** blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **Select** till you are back on the **Optional Configuration** blade.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure SQL database used for the metastore must allow connectivity to other Azure services, including Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure SQL database used for the metastore must allow connectivity to other Azure services, including Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure SQL database dashboard, on the right side, click the server name.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure SQL database dashboard, on the right side, click the server name.

trans-unit.source: This is the server on which the SQL database instance is running.
trans-unit.target: This is the server on which the SQL database instance is running.

trans-unit.source: Once you are on the server view, click **Configure**, and then for **Azure Services**, click **Yes**, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Once you are on the server view, click **Configure**, and then for **Azure Services**, click **Yes**, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: **Script Actions** if you want to use a custom script to customize a cluster, as the cluster is being created.
trans-unit.target: **Script Actions** if you want to use a custom script to customize a cluster, as the cluster is being created.

trans-unit.source: For more information about script actions, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about script actions, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).

trans-unit.source: On the Script Actions blade provide the details as shown in the screen capture.
trans-unit.target: On the Script Actions blade provide the details as shown in the screen capture.

trans-unit.source: Script action blade
trans-unit.target: Script action blade

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage Keys**: Specify additional storage accounts to associate with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage Keys**: Specify additional storage accounts to associate with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: In the **Azure Storage Keys** blade, click **Add a storage key**, and then select an existing storage account or create a new account.
trans-unit.target: In the **Azure Storage Keys** blade, click **Add a storage key**, and then select an existing storage account or create a new account.

trans-unit.source: Additional storage blade
trans-unit.target: Additional storage blade

trans-unit.source: Click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Selecting **Pin to Startboard** will add a tile for cluster to the Startboard of your preview portal.
trans-unit.target: Selecting **Pin to Startboard** will add a tile for cluster to the Startboard of your preview portal.

trans-unit.source: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.
trans-unit.target: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.

trans-unit.source: While provisioning
trans-unit.target: While provisioning

trans-unit.source: Provisioning complete
trans-unit.target: Provisioning complete

trans-unit.source: Provisioning indicator on startboard
trans-unit.target: Provisioning indicator on startboard

trans-unit.source: Provisioned cluster tile
trans-unit.target: Provisioned cluster tile

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the **Notifications** entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the **Notifications** entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: Once the provisioning completes, click the tile for the cluster from the Startboard to launch the cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: Once the provisioning completes, click the tile for the cluster from the Startboard to launch the cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: The cluster blade provides essential information about the cluster such as the name, the resource group it belongs to, the location, the operating system, URL for the cluster dashboard, etc.
trans-unit.target: The cluster blade provides essential information about the cluster such as the name, the resource group it belongs to, the location, the operating system, URL for the cluster dashboard, etc.

trans-unit.source: Cluster blade
trans-unit.target: Cluster blade

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the icons at the top of this blade, and in the **Essentials** section:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the icons at the top of this blade, and in the **Essentials** section:

trans-unit.source: **Settings** and **All Settings**: Displays the **Settings** blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Settings** and **All Settings**: Displays the **Settings** blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Dashboard**, **Cluster Dashboard**, and **URL**: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is a Web portal to run jobs on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Dashboard**, **Cluster Dashboard**, and **URL**: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is a Web portal to run jobs on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Remote Desktop**: Enables you to enable/disable remote desktop on the cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: **Remote Desktop**: Enables you to enable/disable remote desktop on the cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: **Scale Cluster**: Allows you to change the number of worker nodes for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Scale Cluster**: Allows you to change the number of worker nodes for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Delete**: Deletes the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Delete**: Deletes the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Quickstart** (![cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/quickstart.png)): Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: **Quickstart** (![cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/quickstart.png)): Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: **Users** (![users icon](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/users.png)): Allows you to set permissions for _portal management_ of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: **Users** (![users icon](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/users.png)): Allows you to set permissions for _portal management_ of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] This _only_ affects access and permissions to this cluster in the preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] This _only_ affects access and permissions to this cluster in the preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Tags** (![tag icon](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/tags.png)): Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.
trans-unit.target: **Tags** (![tag icon](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/tags.png)): Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may create a key named __project__, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may create a key named __project__, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.

trans-unit.source: Provision using Azure Resource Manager template
trans-unit.target: Provision using Azure Resource Manager template

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) template makes it easier to deploy and redeploy cluster.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) template makes it easier to deploy and redeploy cluster.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure creates a Hadoop cluster on the Linux operating system in the North Europe data center with 4 worker nodes.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure creates a Hadoop cluster on the Linux operating system in the North Europe data center with 4 worker nodes.

trans-unit.source: To deploy a cluster using ARM template
trans-unit.target: To deploy a cluster using ARM template

trans-unit.source: Save the json file in the Appendix A to your workstation.
trans-unit.target: Save the json file in the Appendix A to your workstation.

trans-unit.source: Make the parameters if needed.
trans-unit.target: Make the parameters if needed.

trans-unit.source: Run the template using the following PowerShell script:
trans-unit.target: Run the template using the following PowerShell script:

trans-unit.source: For deploying an ARM template using other methods, see [Deploy an application with Azure Resource Manager template](resource-group-template-deploy.md).
trans-unit.target: For deploying an ARM template using other methods, see [Deploy an application with Azure Resource Manager template](resource-group-template-deploy.md).

trans-unit.source: Provision using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Provision using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions on how to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions on how to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For information on configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see [Administer HDInsight using PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see [Administer HDInsight using PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: For the list of the HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see [HDInsight cmdlet reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn858087.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For the list of the HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see [HDInsight cmdlet reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn858087.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell:
trans-unit.target: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell:

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure resource group
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure resource group

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Blob container
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Blob container

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Provision using the HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Provision using the HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that make it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET Framework application.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that make it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET Framework application.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions below to create a Visual Studio console application and paste the code for creating a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions below to create a Visual Studio console application and paste the code for creating a cluster.

trans-unit.source: To create a Visual Studio console application
trans-unit.target: To create a Visual Studio console application

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.

trans-unit.source: From **New Project**, type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: From **New Project**, type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Category
trans-unit.target: Category

trans-unit.source: Templates/Visual C#/Windows
trans-unit.target: Templates/Visual C#/Windows

trans-unit.source: Template
trans-unit.target: Template

trans-unit.source: Console Application
trans-unit.target: Console Application

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: CreateHDICluster
trans-unit.target: CreateHDICluster

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to create the project.

trans-unit.source: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Manage Nuget Packages for Solutions**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Manage Nuget Packages for Solutions**.

trans-unit.source: In the Search text box within the dialog box, search for **HDInsight**.
trans-unit.target: In the Search text box within the dialog box, search for **HDInsight**.

trans-unit.source: From the results that show up, install the following:
trans-unit.target: From the results that show up, install the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight.Job
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight.Job

trans-unit.source: Search for Azure Authentication and from the results that show up, install **Microsoft.Azure.Common.Authentication**.
trans-unit.target: Search for Azure Authentication and from the results that show up, install **Microsoft.Azure.Common.Authentication**.

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, double-click **Program.cs** to open it, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables:
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, double-click **Program.cs** to open it, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables:

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the application.

trans-unit.source: A console window should open and display the status of the application.
trans-unit.target: A console window should open and display the status of the application.

trans-unit.source: You will also be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.
trans-unit.target: You will also be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.

trans-unit.source: It can take several minutes to create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: It can take several minutes to create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Creating HDInsight cluster using on-premises SQL Server Integration Services
trans-unit.target: Creating HDInsight cluster using on-premises SQL Server Integration Services

trans-unit.source: You can also use SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to create or delete an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can also use SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to create or delete an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Feature Pack for SSIS provides the following components that work with HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Feature Pack for SSIS provides the following components that work with HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight Create Cluster Task
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight Create Cluster Task

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight Delete Cluster Task
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight Delete Cluster Task

trans-unit.source: Azure Subscription Connection Manager
trans-unit.target: Azure Subscription Connection Manager

trans-unit.source: Learn more about the Azure Feature Pack for SSIS [here][ssispack].
trans-unit.target: Learn more about the Azure Feature Pack for SSIS [here][ssispack].

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this article, you have learned several ways to provision an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned several ways to provision an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see the following articles:

trans-unit.target: [Get started with Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-get-started.md) - Learn how to start working with your HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.target: [Use Sqoop with HDInsight](hdinsight-use-sqoop.md) - Learn how to copy data between HDInsight and SQL Database or SQL Server

trans-unit.source: [Administer HDInsight using PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md) - Learn how to work with HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: [Administer HDInsight using PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md) - Learn how to work with HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.target: [Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically](hdinsight-submit-hadoop-jobs-programmatically.md) - Learn how to programmatically submit jobs to HDInsight

trans-unit.target: The following Azure Resource Manger template creates a Hadoop cluster with the dependent Azure storage account.
